name: places/ChIJ-xAmww1ZwokRZiFWRgypmwI
formattedAddress: 25 Waterside Plaza, New York, NY 10010, USA
adrFormatAddress: 25 Waterside Plaza, New York, NY 10010, USA

originalText.text: Chris is very nice, he showed us around the apartment and facilities. The apartment is wonderful with an amazing view. Close to Baruch college, about 15 minutes on foot.

text.text: Chris is very nice, he showed us around the apartment and facilities. The apartment is wonderful with an amazing view. Close to Baruch college, about 15 minutes on foot.

originalText.text: I have been living at Waterside Plaza for 2 months and have truly been having a wonderful experience. Travis Power from the leasing office was extraordinarily professional and kind, and went out of his way to get me into my beautiful apartment as soon as possible. He was available for questions and worked with my schedule to get me in to my apartment within 2 days of signing the lease! Having worked with many brokers and leasing agents, I know it is hard to find professionals as compassionate, thoughtful and organized as Travis Power. I am so grateful for my leasing experience and would recommend Travis to anyone!

originalText.text: In the journey of attempting to find the perfect place to live it is so vital having a professional, patient, and understanding person like Chris Dell’armo by your side. Where do I start!! From the very beginning Chris was a game changer. His compassion, expertise, experience, and deep understanding of people’s needs resulted in us finding a phenomenal apartment at Waterside Plaza. His knowledge, commitment, advice, responsiveness, and follow up approach throughout the entire process made everything seamless and enjoyable. I highly recommend Chris and Waterside Plaza to anyone who is interested in finding a phenomenal new place to call home.

originalText.text:
DO NOT MOVE HERE.

There is mold and you will get sick.

They do not care about their tenants whatsoever. I have never had this experience in an apartment before and I've lived in doorman buildings since I moved to Manhattan in 2014. Take it from me and move to View 34 instead. We moved into a "newly renovated apartment" and within a year our floors started buckling. We didn't get this fixed for weeks and only got 2 weeks of rent taken off our lease. Now a year later, the same issue is happening, the floor is leaking water into my kitchen, and the team refuses to do a mold test (not a great feeling for my health). They do not answer emails in a timely manner and just simply show how little they care about tenant's happiness. The entire staff is rude and need some serious management training. Our favorite doorman walked out one day and never came back because he couldn't stand the way he was being treated which comes as a shock to no one. Let's not forget how they will charge you $100 for "pet waste" even if you follow the directions that you are told. Lastly, the "security guard" is falling asleep almost every time we pass him and not fit to be in that position. 0/10 experience for my time here. It is sad.

originalText.text: The new tall African American doorman at 10 Waterside Plaza, is he always in a bad mood like he's constantly on edge? He is very very rude. I thought he just came here to work few months ago but his attitude is disgusting. Everyone else among the doormen in this building is very friendly, and I've been living here for a long time. Most doormen greet me, and he knows who I am too. There have been a few times when I forgot my access card, and while other doormen were understanding and helped me, he always gives me a dirty look and responds with a condescending tone, saying something like, "Don't you have your card? I won't help unless someone else is entering." His attitude is really unpleasant. I'm paying to live here, and I haven't done anything to provoke him. Why should I have to tolerate his behavior?
